channel.title: Taking my laptop screen off
channel.description: Soon I am buying a 21.5 inch lcd monitor for my desk in my room and I will need to have the lid closed when using the screen to conserve on space but the problem is I hate to take it out and lift the lid up to turn the power on and I also heard that the screen can get damaged from heat so I think I could take the screen off and store it safely and If I need to go on a trip I will just screw it back on. Do you think this is a good idea or bad idea? I dont want to put the computer to sleep and such I just want to be able to power it on and off without flipping the lid up and down.

item.title: Taking my laptop screen off
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

I know how to remove it ive swapped the wireless card so I could install mac on it

Read full topic

item.title: Taking my laptop screen off
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

youll have to remove the keyboard to get at the video controller, then disconnect the ribbon wire from the screen to the video controller.

Read full topic
